text: Why are they pointing to different repos?

elements.text: Why are they pointing to different repos?

text: Not sure if this is the case for <@UGTUKUHLN> but one reason is to open source it at some point in a new repo (without history), and keep the old versions in the private repo in a private registry (<https://github.com/JuliaLang/www.julialang.org/pull/1119/files#diff-f0f0e7cafd943e94b822d94743bf07a145e38c0cc78a96b1401dfefb0222e7a9R45|https://github.com/JuliaLang/www.julialang.org/pull/1119/files#diff-f0f0e7cafd943e94b822d94743bf07a145e38c0cc78a96b1401dfefb0222e7a9R45>)

text: Yes, that's a scenario similar to mine.

elements.text: Yes, that's a scenario similar to mine.

text: Seems easier to use `git` to manage the repo then instead of trying to do it through Pkg

elements.text: Seems easier to use
git
to manage the repo then instead of trying to do it through Pkg
Easier for who?

text: Everyone. Pkg is not a git client.

elements.text: Everyone. Pkg is not a git client.

text: But the thing here is what `dev` does in isolation, that has nothing to do with `git`, It's how registry information conflicts are handled.

elements.text: But the thing here is what
dev
does in isolation, that has nothing to do with
git
, It's how registry information conflicts are handled.

text: Well, what would be a better behavior?

elements.text: Well, what would be a better behavior?

text: And `dev` in isolation is just `git clone` + `dev /path...` so if you need a specific remote it seems easier to just clone the remote you want IMO.

elements.text: And
dev
in isolation is just
git clone
dev /path...
so if you need a specific remote it seems easier to just clone the remote you want IMO.

text: Merging registry info for packages with the same name and UUID in multiple registries. For conflicting URL, choose the URL from the registry with the highest version number for that package.

elements.text: Merging registry info for packages with the same name and UUID in multiple registries. For conflicting URL, choose the URL from the registry with the highest version number for that package.

text: I don't think the issue is wanting the ability to choose a remote, it's wanting the latest remote to be chosen.

elements.text: I don't think the issue is wanting the ability to choose a remote, it's wanting the latest remote to be chosen.

text: I mean, that is also a heuristic, just as taking the first one (if that is what currently happens, I don't know).

elements.text: I mean, that is also a heuristic, just as taking the first one (if that is what currently happens, I don't know).

text:
